review.title: Arrhythmia Detection using Mutual Information-Based Integration Method
review.abstract: The aim of this paper is to propose an application of mutual information-based ensemble methods to the analysis and classification of heart beats associated with different types of Arrhythmia. Models of multilayer perceptrons, support vector machines, and radial basis function neural networks were trained and tested using the MIT-BIH arrhythmia database. This research brings a focus to an ensemble method that, to our knowledge, is a novel application in the area of ECG Arrhythmia detection. The proposed classifier ensemble method showed improved performance, relative to either majority voting classifier integration or to individual classifier performance. The overall ensemble accuracy was 98.25%.

metadata.title: Arrhythmia Detection using Mutual Information-Based Integration

sections.text: This research focuses on an ensemble method which, to our knowledge, represents a new application in the field of detection of ECG arrhythmias. The proposed ensemble method showed an improved performance, both in relation to the integration of the majority choice classifier and to the performance of the individual classifier. The overall ensemble accuracy was 98.25%. Keywords: detection of arrhythmia, mutual information, EK gene ensemble classification, neural networks.
